net.sf.prefixedproperties.spring

Class PrefixedPropertiesPlaceholderConfigurer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.core.io.support.PropertiesLoaderSupport
      • org.springframework.beans.factory.config.PropertyResourceConfigurer
        • org.springframework.beans.factory.config.PlaceholderConfigurerSupport
          • org.springframework.beans.factory.config.PropertyPlaceholderConfigurer
            • net.sf.prefixedproperties.spring.PrefixedPropertiesPlaceholderConfigurer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanFactoryAware, org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanNameAware, org.springframework.beans.factory.config.BeanFactoryPostProcessor, org.springframework.beans.factory.config.BeanPostProcessor, org.springframework.core.Ordered, org.springframework.core.PriorityOrdered

    @ManagedResource(value="prefixedproperties:name=PrefixedPropertiesPlaceholderConfigurer")
public class PrefixedPropertiesPlaceholderConfigurer
extends org.springframework.beans.factory.config.PropertyPlaceholderConfigurer
implements org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanFactoryAware, org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanNameAware, org.springframework.beans.factory.config.BeanPostProcessor
    Works the same as PropertyPlaceholderConfigurer with the advantage to filter properties by using a specific environment. Mainly it is enough to set the current environment by using setDefaultPrefix(String)
    For special situation it is also possible that you can use setPrefixConfigs(List) to configure the known prefixes.
    To configure the default prefix you can use the following methods: setEnvironmentFactory(EnvironmentFactory)
    setDefaultPrefixSystemPropertyKey(String)
    setDefaultPrefix(String)
    The usage of the methods will be in the same order as above.

        public void setDefaultPrefixSystemPropertyKey(String defaultPrefixSystemPropertyKey)
        Sets this method to specify a system property to be used as an environment. The value of the property will be used for setting the default prefix. PrefixedProperties.setDefaultPrefix(String)
        Parameters:

      • setProcessOtherProperties

        public void setProcessOtherProperties(boolean value)
        Indicates if other properties within this spring-context should get processed according these prefixed properties. For example other properties replacements will get replaced by properties from this prefixed properties values and this environment configuration. This is usefull in the case that you have to define a set of properties which should not get mixed up with other properties but should get environment specific values for example Log4j.
        You can also use PrefixedPropertiesFactoryBean to load properties these properties on there own and have your own environment.
        Default is false
        Parameters:
        value - the new process properties
        See Also:
        PrefixedPropertiesFactoryBean

      • setProperties

        public void setProperties(Properties properties)
        Overrides:
